question: You and your family are living in rented accommodation in an English speaking country. You are not satisfied with the condition of some of the furniture.Write a letter to your landlord. In your letterintroduce yourselfexplain what is wrong with the furnituresay what action you would like the landlord to take
text: I am Rami Musmar, living on the second floor, apartment number 203 in Venetian Building, one of your properties in Town square accommodation. I moved last month with my family for immigration purposes and to continue my master's studies at XYZ University.

I would like to express my happiness with the accommodation facility, such as  a kid's play area where my kids can enjoy their time with neighbours and a gym facility which has a variety of new equipment.

Unfortunately, this happiness is not there when I see the condition of the apartment furniture, for example, two kitchen cabinets are broken, the living sofa has damaged from the back and the bedroom cupboard shelves are broken.

I would like to request you to take  serious action by visiting the apartment and list down the damages, furthermore, I am expecting to get replacement and repairs of all damages on your expenses  since this situation was there when I moved to the apartment and I raised this multiple occasion to your office team without any further response from them.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
